job.text_description: Who we areMaestro exists to help others perform beautifully. We believe that every problem can be impacted by design, technology, and people that care. That’s why we’ve packed these four walls with dreamers and doers ready to design meaningful experiences that help our partners, their people, and their brand perform beautifully. Our team works collaboratively to intentionally craft solutions for Branding & Marketing, Learning, Software, and Media.Who you areYou are a talented JavaScript developer who’s comfortable working with modern web development technologies including: TypeScript, Angular, StencilJS, Ionic and Capacitor, to develop web and mobile solutions for clients and partners of Maestro. You’re empathetic to the needs and wants of the users of the applications you are building as well as the Product Owners who are managing the project budget. You have a thoughtful way of coding that promotes the longevity of the product. If you have a passion for architecture, UX, client engagement, BA, QA, or any other facet of the development process we’ll find a way to let it shine. And, if you’d rather focus on code, we’ll work to keep the noise out of the way.What you’ll be doing on the Software Team(Build cool stuff and work with cool people)Collaborate with designers, account managers, and (potentially) clients to solve business needsCreate top-notch, developer-friendly software that performs beautifullyLearn from others on the team and share what you know or have been learningSupport multiple customers with varying business cases – on time and on budgetProvide estimates to help inform backlog prioritizationCommunicate updates in effort or scope to help keep the client aware of changesArchitect solutions in a way that common code can be shared within and across projectsTalents we’re looking forExperience developing client-side JavaScript applications, preferably using a framework (e.g., Angular, React, Vue)Experience with Angular 8+: modules, routing, components, directives, pipes, guards, resolves, and servicesFamiliarity with web components (StencilJS, Polymer)Familiarity with testing frameworks (Jasmine, Mocha, Karma, Jest)Experience with using package managers for distributing reusable code (NPM, yarn)Familiarity with version control (Git, Mercurial, Subversion)Familiarity with HTML5 APIs (canvas, audio, local storage, WebRTC, PWA)Strong working knowledge of HTML and CSSExperience with cross-browser and cross-platform developmentExperience with responsive design and Progressive Web AppsExperience with WAI-ARIA and a11y is a plusFamiliarity with PhoneGap/Cordova/Capacitor/Ionic FrameworkThe perksBase salary. We take your experience and talent level into great considerationCompensation package that includes medical, dental, life insurance, and optional 401KWork/life balance. Life happens, and here you have the time and freedom to deal with itWe believe in an inclusive environmentMaestro is committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, ability, or if you’re parenting the next generation of innovators, we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.
job.title: Front-End Software Engineer

location_names: Malvern, Pennsylvania, United States
job.text_description: In this role you willBuild your technical and strategic skills as you work alongside crew from across the businessDesign front-end and back-end solutions for test-driven developmentChampion innovative ways, from concept to execution, that will help give crew and our clients the best chance for successShare your ideas and make your voice heard in an open collaborative team environmentUse your agility and curious mind to respond to new challenges in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environmentFollow agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban or adopt Lean principlesBuild Angular web applications and Restful micro-services using Java hosted on the AWS cloudWork on continuous delivery pipeline using Bamboo and run automated tests using Junit, Protractor, Jasmine and SeleniumExpand your career horizonsWorking in Technology instills you with a constant desire to learn new abilities and adapt to emerging trends. Vanguard gives you the freedom to explore new career possibilities, helping develop the skills and confidence needed to let a career in technology flourish. Utilize your creative approach to finding solutions in an open and inclusive environment where we value your unique perspective and natural curiosity.What it takesUndergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience0 – 3 years of relevant experienceGood written and oral communication skillsGood analysis and problem solving skillsSpecial FactorsVanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.About VanguardWe are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.Inclusion StatementVanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard’s core purpose.Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.
job.title: Developer – Entry-level – 2021 Start Date

location_names: San Francisco, California, United States
job.text_description: Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!The Opportunity As an Associate Business Strategy Analyst in the Digital Media business unit, you will perform quantitative analysis and data modeling to inform business strategy. In addition, you will contribute on cross-functional projects to help the business achieve its potential in terms of revenue, customer success, and operational excellence. With a Total Addressable Market (TAM) sized at $44B, this is an exciting opportunity to support the next wave of growth for the Creative Cloud and Document Cloud solutions!What you'll Do Size business opportunities and provide granular insights to deeply understand where the largest or most addressable opportunities remain.Collaborate with product management, product marketing, and Go-To-Market (GTM) teams on data analysis for critical business decisions.Analyze complex business problems using data from internal and external sources to provide insights to decision-makers.Own data models used to run the business and utilize sophisticated statistical and mathematical methods to provide solutions to business needs.Produce datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools.What you need to succeed We are looking for an ambitious and results-oriented individual - an analytical wiz with outstanding communication skills, high initiative, and leadership potential. Specific requirements include:Preferred Masters degree in quantitative field like Statistics, Mathematics, Business, or Computer Science.Proficiency with SQL, Hive or similar querying languages.Experience with data communication and visualization tools like Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Must be a highly collaborative team player.

location_names: Raleigh, North Carolina, United States
job.text_description: Applied Research Associates (ARA), Inc. Southeast Division has an immediate need for an experienced IT Professional to serve as Systems Analyst for the Software, Systems and Modeling Sector in Raleigh, NC. The successful applicant will establish operational databases, software configuration control and system interfaces for computer system(s) assigned, maintain file servers, network access, and document and analyze system anomalies to ensure optimum equipment performance. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for preparing system for operational use and support operational tests.In this position, Information Systems Analyst will build, configure and maintain systems that adhere to government regulations.What you’ll do as a Staff Systems Specialist:Systems analysts (also known as Information Systems Security Officers, or ISSOs as defined by the Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency, or DCSA) maintains and monitors compliant information systems for use on government contracts.What you’ll need to be a successful Staff Systems Specialist:Active Secret Security ClearanceBachelor's Degree along with 2-4 years' of relevant work experience OR 8-10 years' of experience in lieu of a degreeAt least 1 year of hands-on experience with Windows 10 administration (setup, support, updates, GPOs)At least 1 year of exposure to Windows Servers support (2008, 2012, 2016) and related components (Active Directory, File Server, Group Policy)Superb customer service skills with an emphasis on phone support; a sincere desire to help othersA problem-solver by nature; a natural inclination to learn and come up with the best solutionExperience with network troubleshooting and administration (Ethernet, Wi-Fi, DNS, DHCP, VPNs, VLANs, firewalls, routers, switches)Excellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to work collaboratively with team members and executivesInformation Systems Analyst Preferences:Cisco experienceCompTIA Security+ (or able to obtain within 6 months of employment)Some scripting knowledge (e.g. powershell)About Us:Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1,500 professionals and continues to grow. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) & 401(k) with matching program, benefits package which includes medical, dental vision, flex spending, telehealth services, company-paid life & disability insurance including paid maternity disability leave through our company-paid short-term disability benefit, domestic partner coverage, dependent care flex spending, daycare discounts, pet insurance, relocation opportunities, floating holidays, tuition reimbursement, professional development as well as flexible schedules with remote/work from home options. ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments. Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.

job.title: Jr. Software Developer

location_names: Reston, Virginia, United States
job.text_description: If you want to accelerate your career growth and are passionate about applying your expertise to solve problems of national importance, then we have the job you are looking for! You will be able to achieve your personal and professional goals in a stable environment that emphasizes and rewards the entrepreneurial spirit. Not only will you solve challenging core problems, you’ll be able to grow your career in an exciting environment that promotes teamwork and cross-training in a wide range of related disciplines. The successful candidate for this position will have a strong passion and background in making quality production software at all stages of the software lifecycle. You will be a key member of a team that is developing simulation tools and technologies to support real-world planning and intelligence operations for the Department of Defense. You will serve as an on-site member of the software team responsible for designing, developing, and deploying AWS cloud compute infrastructure and the applications that will run on this infrastructure.The opportunity for career advancement and continued learning at ARA does not stop there. We strive to identify cross-train opportunities and encourage staff to become involved in upcoming R&D efforts as well as interject new ideas into our longstanding operational programs. At ARA, we foster an environment where technical staff are empowered to research and develop their own ideas –with resources and support from a strong internal technical team and external partners. You can expect day to day to have flexibility in choosing the level of autonomy suited to you, while at the same time enjoying a challenging technical career with great opportunity for personal growth. Software Engineer Requirements:Must be a U.S. Citizen with an active Top Secret Security ClearanceBS or MS in computer science, engineering, applied mathematics, or a closely related field2-4 years of relevant work experienceExperience with at least one modern software development ecosystem, such as Python, and comfortable implementing quick-turnaround, proof of concept solutions in that ecosystemExperience architecting or maintaining a full server-side technology stack, building real-time, scalable web applications, and/or deploying applications within cloud computing providers such as AWS or AzureExperience developing/maintaining web APIs with RESTDesire to solve challenging real-world customer problems and communicate complex concepts to non-expert audiencesTeam player with excellent communication skillsRelocation to Reston, VA; this position involves minimal travel for collaboration with customers and partnersSoftware Engineer Preferences: Strong coding skills in a high-level language (Python, C++, Java, )Demonstrated experience in developing web API’s AWS certification(s), preferably at the associates level or higherFamiliarity with Docker and KubernetesExperience with backend web frameworks (e.g. Django, Flask)Experience configuring web servers (e.g. Apache)Experience in CI/CD workflowsExperience with agile software developmentAbout Us:Applied Research Associates, Inc. (aka ARA) is an employee-owned international research and engineering company known for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. We were founded in Albuquerque, NM in 1979 as the disco era was, thankfully, closing out and the personal computer era was beginning. We employ over 1,400 professionals and continue to grow. ARA offices throughout the U.S. and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. Around ARA you are equally likely to hear a conversation about Kubernetes clusters as you are a debate on merits of a reverse polish notation (RPN) calculator!While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) & 401(k) with matching program, benefits package which includes medical, dental vision, flex spending, telehealth services, company-paid life & disability insurance including paid maternity disability leave through our company-paid short-term disability benefit, domestic partner coverage, dependent care flex spending, daycare discounts, pet insurance, relocation opportunities, floating holidays, tuition reimbursement, professional development as well as flexible schedules with remote/work from home options. ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments. Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) & 401(k) with matching program, benefits package which includes medical, dental vision, flex spending, telehealth services, company-paid life & disability insurance including paid maternity disability leave through our company-paid short-term disability benefit, domestic partner coverage, dependent care flex spending, daycare discounts, pet insurance, relocation opportunities, floating holidays, tuition reimbursement, professional development as well as flexible schedules with remote/work from home options. ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments. Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.

job.text_description: Applied Research Associates, Inc. (ARA) is a progressive research and development company with a 30+ year legacy of providing innovative products and services to the government and private sectors. The Southeast Division in Raleigh, NC has a unique opportunity for a Proposal Writer/Editor to support our team by playing a vital role in presenting compelling and compliant proposal documents in response to proposal requirements.As a proposal writer/editor you will work collaboratively with our technical and management subject matter experts to write documents and edit content. You will ensure our documents clearly articulate the team’s overall solution and approach, processes, program management activities, risks/mitigations, past performance, etc. In this role, you assist the assigned Proposal Manager to locate, track and integrate proposal content. You will also be responsible for document formats based on request for proposal (RFP) specifications, consistent look and feel among proposal documents, appropriate language use, and adherence to Microsoft Word style sheets.A successful candidate must possess the ability to engage with technical staff and subject matter experts; capture key concepts and ideas; write in clear, concise, and persuasive language. The successful candidate will translate technical concepts into easily understandable text and graphics, rewrite/review proposal documents, and help enforce/train the proposal process. The successful candidate will also be able to create/format simple charts and diagrams using PowerPoint’s drawing tools.Our proposal team uses a variety of software, including MS SharePoint and Adobe Acrobat Pro. Technical writers also require extensive Microsoft Word and PowerPoint knowledge, including Word style sheets. Because our proposal team also assists with proposal pricing volumes, they should also be familiar with Microsoft Excel.Technical Proposal Writer / Editor Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree3-5 years’ experience writing technical and management documentationExpert-level Microsoft Word and PowerPoint skillsExperience developing visuals (e.g., graphics, charts)Expert ability to synthesize and communicate technical information in consistent, understandable languageAbility to work well in a team and independentlyAbility to work effectively under tight deadlinesTechnical Proposal Writer / Editor Preferred Qualifications:Active Department of Defense security clearanceAbout Us:Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1,100 professionals and continues to grow. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.While this is all of the “Year One and Beyond” stuff, “Day One” is highly impressive too. results.job_name: Senior Native Mobile Software Engineer (iOS or Android)

location_names: Raleigh, North Carolina, United States
job.text_description: Applied Research Associates, Inc. (ARA) is seeking a versatile mobile software engineer for a full-time permanent position at the Southeast Division in Raleigh, NC. We are recruiting at the mid-career level for candidates with diverse skills and interest in developing commercial products and contributing to engineering and research. The successful candidate will join a multi-disciplined collaborative team within the Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Directorate building tools for defense and intelligence applications and growing our commercial product portfolio.This new position targets individuals desiring challenging technical work within a team environment and it provides an excellent growth opportunity for candidates interested in applied research and end-to-end concept development. Job responsibilities include: (1) developing and maintaining a native iOS or Android codebase for mobile applications; (2) defining technical requirements based on design artifacts such as user stories; (3) leverage custom or niche APIs to share real-time information between users (4) automating system testing/monitoring. Flexibility to operate as a full stack developer and contribute to backend deployment, depending on project needs, is preferred. Candidates with an entrepreneurial spirit who are seeking opportunities for personal and professional growth in a stable environment are strongly encouraged to apply.Native Mobile Software Engineer (iOS or Android) Initial Work Areas:Maintain and improve the mobile client codebase and feature set for ARA’s commercial smartphone appPartner with the backend team to optimize current architecture and find improvements to scale horizontally for thousands of usersContribute to dynamic team researching and developing defense and IC related technologies serving Government programs and commercial productsNative Mobile Software Engineer (iOS or Android) Required Experience & Skills:Eligibility to apply for and hold a US security clearance (selected applicants will undergo a security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements at the time of employment).BS in computer science, computer engineering, or related technical fieldMinimum 7 years of relevant software development experienceExperience developing and maintaining native mobile applications (Android and/or iOS). Swift or Kotlin experience is preferredPrior experience implementing in-app payments or an ad network for commercial applicationsDevelopment experience within applications that share information between users in real time, either through a custom networking solution or using a game engine approachNative Mobile Software Engineer (iOS or Android) Preferred Experience & Skills:Above all, we value passion, a desire to learn, and teamwork. We are confident that if you possess the right attitude, work ethic, and skill set that you could succeed in the role. In addition to the experience and skills above, if you have any of the following you will be able to accelerate your effectiveness and impact.Prior experience working with mapping/GIS data, or augmented realitySome experience with backend development (i.e. development of a custom API, database design, hosting and deploying via cloud provider such as AWS, etc)Existing or prior US security clearanceAbout Us:Applied Research Associates, Inc. job.text_description: If you want to accelerate your career growth and are passionate about applying your expertise to solve problems then we have the job you are looking for. You will be part of a unique team focused on developing the next generation of United States Air Force Targeteers, and as a certified PPM Instructor, you will develop the student’s analytical and critical thinking skills for real-world contingency operations.As an ARA Instructor, you will also evaluate student proficiency, compile and analyze student feedback, and provide senior leaders with recommendations regarding curriculum and course material improvements. job.text_description: Make the next step in your career count! Join a company where your contributions are recognized and have a direct effect on your success and ours. Step forward into your best self, and build a future that aligns your personal values with your career goals.   For more than 20 years Acumen solutions has organically grown to 1000+ employees in 10 locations including our US based Technology Center in Cleveland, Ohio. We are a cloud focused IT consulting firm, a Top 10 Salesforce Partner, and we’ve been named Mulesoft Partner of the Year. Through our diverse and people-driven culture, we promote collaboration and teamwork, while also celebrating employee individuality. We explore the newest technology and offer opportunities for our employees to continuously develop and progress in their careers by providing continuous training, e-learning, and certifications at no cost to our employees. Our strong corporate responsibility program includes opportunities to give back through pro bono projects, community support, volunteering, and "pay it forward" programs.The Acumen Solutions Cleveland Technology Center is home base to over 200 technical consultants working in a fun, collaborative environment that is focused on continuous learning. We promote a strong technical environment unlike any other in Northeast Ohio.      At Acumen Solutions you are not just a consultant, you are a valuable team member and a trusted client advisor. Join Acumen Solutions and let us take your next career step together!  Specific DutiesParticipate in the full application life cycle from technical design to development, testing, and deployment using contemporary Cloud based development toolsInteract directly with customer, development team, and other stakeholders to ensure customer successDesign, develop and integrate Salesforce applications using Visualforce, APEX, Java, .NET, modern web technologies, and native mobile platforms (iOS, Android)Work with technical teams and senior architects to finalize architecture specifications, and creates design as it relates to the customization and/or integration of software solutionsDevelop proofs of concept (POC) as needed, integrating new components with back office systems during the design and requirements phase to evaluate products and integration strategiesValidate application code against unit tests, security tests, and profiling toolsAssist in identifying, troubleshooting, and resolving defects encountered during various stages of project delivery, including during the deployment and implementation of the solution in production environmentsProduce project documentation, including functional and technical designs, and end-user guides RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related majorCo-op, internship or 0-1 years' work experienceStrong understanding of web and object-oriented development, with Java, C#, or comparable OOP languageAbility/desire to be in a continuous learning environment and to learn new technologies and development tools quicklyA creative mindset to apply innovative approaches to software designDesire to work in a highly collaborative environment with a large team of like-minded DevelopersAuthorized to work for any U.S. employer
job.title: Software Developer - Spring 2021 Grads

location_names: Orlando, Florida, United States
job.text_description: Want to create software that makes a difference? At Applied Research Associates (ARA), our goal is to improve our nation’s safety, security, and way of life. Join us!We’re looking for dedicated, hard-working software developers with a passion for using modeling and simulation technologies to develop state-of-the-art 3D training applications. We’re seeking candidates that are go-getters that work independently. But, we also have a strong team dynamic. You will be a key member of a team that is solving real-world problems for military customers.You will work in an agile team environment on several Research and Development (R&D) projects to develop tools, applications, and processes to support serious games and other 3D simulations. You will serve multiple projects simultaneously, so agility, focus, and communication skills are a must. You must be able to use your knowledge of computer science concepts to solve problems.Why Work For Us?The opportunity to make a real impact. The ARA Orlando office has been doing cutting-edge modeling and simulation research for over fifteen years. Everyone who works here is important, from new faces to those who have worked here since the beginning. Your contribution matters—you won’t be just a number!Flexible, reasonable hours. We encourage all employees to have a good work/life balance. We do not believe in burning you out! We invest in our people and want you to be happy with us for the long-haul.Competitive salaries and outstanding benefits. We provide generous retirement contributions--one of the best packages in the industry. We also provide generous medical, dental, and vision coverage; company-paid life and long-term disability insurance; and annual performance bonuses.Staff Software Engineer Requirements:Candidates selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified informationBS (or higher) in Computer Science or similar discipline (Computer Engineering, Physics, Math, Electrical Engineering, etc.) with 5+ years’ experience, or MS degree plus 3 years. Note: If degree isn’t in Computer Science, experience using and knowledge of computer science concepts must be clearly demonstratedEquivalent professional experience (11+ years) will be considered for talented candidates without degreeDemonstrated passion and enthusiasm for using knowledge and skills to solve problems and produce high-quality workStrong object-oriented programming skills and demonstrated knowledge of good software engineering practicesAbility to quickly understand existing code and enhance and build on an existing architectureStrong math skills and solid understanding of algorithm design and optimizationDemonstrated ability to work both autonomously as well as with large and small teams of programmersExcellent written and verbal communication skillsPreference to applicants with one or more of the following:C++ knowledge and skillsExperience developing training simulations, 3D environments, or serious gamesExperience using modeling and simulation techniquesExperience on mobile platform development (IOS, Android)Experience with DirectX or OpenGL APIsFamiliarity with modern 3D rendering techniques (Shaders, Lighting Models, GLSL etc.)Specialization in one or more of the following areas: UI, Tools Development, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Physics, Graphics, Networking, MathExperience with web-based technologies, including REST and JavascriptUnreal Engine or Unity programming skillsKnowledge or familiarity with interoperability standards in simulations, e.g., OGC web servicesExperience with Amazon Web Services or other cloud technologiesExperience writing technical design documentationCompany Information:At the ARA Orlando office, we create immersive, 3D interactive learning solutions and high-fidelity synthetic virtual environments. We work with scientists and engineers of many disciplines and diverse backgrounds to enhance the creativity and innovation of the mission-critical solutions we provide to our customers.ARA is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems. Founded in 1979, ARA currently employs over 1500 professionals and is rapidly growing. Our culture supports our exceptional staff of valued employees and encourages professional growth through continued higher education, participation and publication at technical conferences, and membership in professional organizations. As an ARA employee you are encouraged to generate new ideas and bring those ideas to life. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please visit our website at http://careers.ara.com.

location_names: Raleigh, North Carolina, United States
job.text_description: ARA is expanding our team of developers to accommodate growth in our defense-oriented enterprise systems project portfolio, which includes support to the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and Intelligence Community. We are looking for software developers interested in developing enterprise-scale database systems that leverage Java technologies. As a member of this team, you would be designing, developing, and enhancing web/cloud-based multi-user database systems.ARA offers a highly dynamic work environment where employees create and apply advanced technologies to a wide range of engaging and complex domains. Our customers in the Defense, Homeland Security, and Intelligence sectors perform critical national-interest missions and rely on our systems to accomplish them successfully. ARA teams are highly interactive, constantly improving, and driven by a passion for the types of work they perform.ARA is an employee-owned company with potential opportunities for future employee growth; these may include additional projects, technical leadership, software architecture, and project or personnel management. We are currently hiring to fill multiple gaps created by rapid expansion and are anticipating continued growth. We are therefore entertaining candidates at multiple experience and education levels, with compensation to match capability.Senior Java Database Developer Required Qualifications: All Candidates must have the following to be considered for this role:Technical: Experience with and a passion for developing database systems along with strong Java software development skills (other languages such as JavaScript, C++, and Python may be a plus, but our enterprise services are mostly Java-based).Teamwork: An ability to work well on a project team that often includes interdisciplinary experts. We are looking for people that get along well with others in a collaborative setting and can also work independently when needed.Education: A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant area (e.g., Computer Science) along with 7-9 years' experience.Attitude: A positive can-do attitude befitting of an ARA employee-owner and understanding about how their career objectives might map to ARA’s Core Values of Passion, Freedom, Service, and Growth (see http://ara.com/who-we-are for details).Security: All of our projects for this posting require candidates to have the ability to attain some level of US security clearance. Therefore, only candidates with US citizenship can be considered for employment under such projects and existing clearances will be strongly preferred.For more senior levels and higher salary levels, candidates will need to have additional experience, education, and/or expertise in relevant technical areas. (ARA) seeks an experienced Automation Engineer to specify, procure, install, operate and maintain industrial control systems and the processing equipment they control.This Engineer performs a variety of tasks, may provide consultation on complex projects and this person will be a top-level contributor/specialist. location_names: Raleigh, North Carolina, United States
job.text_description: At ARA we are driven by a passion for developing innovative solutions to challenging problems of national importance. Our culture rewards autonomy and initiative and we foster a stable environment where personal and professional growth are prioritized.For this position we are looking for highly skilled software engineers to join our augmented reality team. ARA’s ARC4 augmented reality technology is used by the US Army and others to improve the situational awareness of our soldiers on the battlefield. ARC4 provides accurate, timely information so that teams can make the right decisions and operate with enhanced safety and speed. It is not an overstatement to say that this capability will save lives, by improving coordination, decisiveness, and communication.Specifically, we need engineers and scientists who have the ability or interest to design and implement defense-grade augmented reality software. The software you develop will be fielded on a wide range of Army systems, including night vision goggles, ground vehicles, and far target locators.Our technology:C++17 application software built for Windows, Linux, and Android (heavy use of Android NDK) using Qt, OpenGL, Eigen, libUSB, and ZMQKotlin application software built for Windows and Android using JavaFXMicrocontroller software built in Rust and CEmbedded web server software built with Node.js and ReactCI build and package management system built with Jenkins, CMake, Gradle, and ConanOur team’s interests:Low-latency inter-device communication and high-performance inter-process data sharing. We write software that moves inertial sensor data and video data between embedded systems as fast as possible.Extensible software. We write applications for customers who want to build their own add-ons and plug-ins, so we think about APIs, data protocols and how to hot-load 3rd-party code.Safe concurrency. Knowing patterns for working with concurrent code safely is critically important for our applications.Cross-platform code. Our customers use many different platforms, so we know the difference between compiling with GCC vs Clang vs MSVC and when to utilize the JVM or web technology.Our code runs on devices that people work with and wear in heterogeneous processing hardware under unique resource constraints. This also means we employ multiple strategies to test our code from automated unit testing to device emulation and field testing.Putting math to work. Our products are often born from research projects which means learning and applying advanced math is how we deliver for our customers.Entry-level Augmented Reality Software Engineer Requirements:Due to the nature of work, qualified candidates must be U.S. CitizensA Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field with 0-2 years of experience A strong understanding of either C++17, Kotlin, or RustSome experience in at least one of our technologies or interestsA strong desire to learn another of our other technologies or interestsAbout Us:Applied Research Associates, Inc. (aka ARA) is an employee-owned international research and engineering company known for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. We were founded in Albuquerque, NM in 1979 as the disco era was, thankfully, closing out and the personal computer era was beginning. We employ over 1,400 professionals and continue to grow. ARA offices throughout the U.S. and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. Around ARA you are equally likely to hear a conversation about Kubernetes clusters as you are a debate on merits of a reverse polish notation (RPN) calculator!While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) & 401(k) with matching program, benefits package which includes medical, dental vision, flex spending, telehealth services, company-paid life & disability insurance including paid maternity disability leave through our company-paid short-term disability benefit, domestic partner coverage, dependent care flex spending, daycare discounts, pet insurance, relocation opportunities, floating holidays, tuition reimbursement, professional development as well as flexible schedules with remote/work from home options. ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments. Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.

job.text_description: If you are looking for a career as a Senior System Engineer, and you are interested in designing, developing and rapidly deploying cloud based solutions to problems of national importance, then our Raleigh, NC division of ARA has an exciting opportunity worth considering. Not only will you solve challenging core problems, you’ll be able to grow your career in an exciting environment that promotes teamwork and cross-training in a wide range of related disciplines. The successful candidate for this position will have a strong passion in designing and implementing edge-based solutions for new and/or existing software applications. You will have the opportunity to inject new ideas into our longstanding operational programs. At ARA, we foster an environment where technical staff are empowered to research and develop their own ideas with resources and support from a strong internal technical team and external partners. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1,500 professionals and continues to grow. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The corporation realizes that employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women in order to maximize career and professional accomplishments. job.text_description: Are you passionate about video games? Want to create software that makes a difference? At the Virtual Heroes Division of Applied Research Associates, our goal is to improve your safety, security, and way of life. Join us!We’re looking for dedicated, hard-working programmers with a passion for using game technology to develop state-of-the-art training applications. As a Staff Serious Games Programmer you will be a key member of a team that is solving real-world problems for customers in the military, medical, education, and space industries. Ideal candidates will have broad programming experience on one or more published/deployed projects. You must be able to serve multiple projects simultaneously with agility, poise, and focus. The job location is our game studio in the Research Triangle in Raleigh, North Carolina.Our games are award-winning, reflecting the creativity, dedication, and vision of every member of our studio. You can be part of our team!Why Work For Us?The opportunity to make a real impact. Virtual Heroes has been making quality serious games for fifteen years. Everyone who works here is important, from new faces to those who have worked here since the beginning. Your contribution matters—you won’t be just a number!Flexible, reasonable hours. We encourage all employees to have a good work/life balance. We do not believe in burning you out! We invest in our people and want you to be happy with us for the long-haul.Competitive salaries and outstanding benefits. We provide generous retirement contributions; medical, dental, and vision coverage; company-paid life and long-term disability insurance; and annual performance bonuses.Staff Serious Games Developer Requirements:Candidates selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.BS (or higher) in Computer Science, Game Development, or a similar discipline, plus at least 2 years of related work experience. Equivalent professional experience (at least 8 years) will be considered for talented candidates without a degree.Unreal Engine 4 programming experience.C++ experience and demonstrated knowledge of good software engineering practices.Ability to quickly understand existing code and enhance and build on an existing architecture.Ability to work constructively with artists, designers, QA staff, programmers, and producers.A passion for using state-of-the-art game technology to rapidly prototype systems and produce finished products with quick turnaround times and tight deadlines.Preference to applicants with one or more of the following:Unreal Engine 4 blueprint experience.Experience developing multiplayer game/training applications.Experience with mobile platform development (iOS, Android).Familiarity or experience with web applications built on the Microsoft stack (Windows Server, IIS, MSSQL, C#, ASP.NET) and other web technologies (HTML, JavaScript).Experience performing UE4 technical support and training.Experience with tools development and infrastructure maintenance.Experience with DirectX pipeline and modern 3D rendering techniques such as shaders, lighting models, and HLSL.Additional Requirements:Following a successful phone interview, candidates will be required to take a code exam to demonstrate a variety of development proficiencies.Company Information: At Virtual Heroes, we leverage simulation and digital-games-based paradigms to create applications that teach critical skills. As a division of Applied Research Associates (ARA), we work with scientists and engineers of many disciplines and diverse backgrounds to enhance the creativity and innovation of the mission-critical solutions we provide to our customers.ARA is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems. Founded in Albuquerque, NM in 1979, ARA currently employs over 1200 professionals and is rapidly growing. Our culture supports our exceptional staff of valued employees and encourages professional growth through continued higher education, participation and publication at technical conferences, and membership in professional organizations. As an ARA employee you are encouraged to generate new ideas and bring those ideas to life. ARA offers competitive salaries (DOE) and outstanding benefits including stock ownership, medical and dental coverage, long-term disability insurance, life insurance, a 401(k) profit-sharing plan, and annual bonuses. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please visit our website at http://careers.ara.com.

ARA offices throughout the U.S. and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. Around ARA you are equally likely to hear a conversation about Kubernetes clusters as you are a debate on merits of a reverse polish notation (RPN) calculator!While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) & 401(k) with matching program, benefits package which includes medical, dental vision, flex spending, telehealth services, company-paid life & disability insurance including paid maternity disability leave through our company-paid short-term disability benefit, domestic partner coverage, dependent care flex spending, daycare discounts, pet insurance, relocation opportunities, floating holidays, tuition reimbursement, professional development as well as flexible schedules with remote/work from home options. ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments. Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.

job.text_description: TL;DRHigh-impact software development jobs for smart people.Code that saves lives. As a Software Developer at Epic, you’ll write software that impacts the lives of more than 250 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you’ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you’ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves. Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.The top 15 health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.Work in your own office, eat delicious food, and travel the world.We don’t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but…) You will work in an individual office that will heighten your ability to get stuff done. For lunch, visit King’s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they’re prepared by a culinary team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you’ll earn a four-week sabbatical trip anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyoncé concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.Epic is located just outside Madison, the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison’s first arcade bar.Requirements·        BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field·        A history of academic excellence or professional success·        Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)·        Relocation to Madison, WI area (reimbursed)

They have unique patient populations, local service providers, and intervention tools which make any insight you get from one hospital difficult to apply to another. job.text_description: Want to create software that makes a difference? At Applied Research Associates (ARA), our goal is to improve our nation’s safety, security, and way of life. Join us!We’re looking for dedicated, hard-working software developers with a passion for using modeling and simulation technologies to develop state-of-the-art 3D training applications. We’re seeking candidates that are go-getters that work independently. But, we also have a strong team dynamic. You will be a key member of a team that is solving real-world problems for military customers.You will work in an agile team environment on several Research and Development (R&D) projects to develop tools, applications, and processes to support serious games and other 3D simulations. You must be able to use your knowledge of computer science concepts to solve problems.Why Work For Us?The opportunity to make a real impact. The ARA Orlando office has been doing cutting-edge modeling and simulation research for over fifteen years. We encourage all employees to have a good work/life balance. We do not believe in burning you out! We invest in our people and want you to be happy with us for the long-haul.Competitive salaries and outstanding benefits. We also provide generous medical, dental, and vision coverage; company-paid life and long-term disability insurance; and annual performance bonuses.Junior Software Engineer Requirements:Candidates selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified informationBS (or higher) in Computer Science or similar discipline, such as Computer Engineering, Physics, Math, Electrical Engineering, etc. Note: If degree isn’t in Computer Science, experience using and knowledge of computer science concepts must be clearly demonstratedEquivalent professional experience (6+ years) will be considered for talented candidates without degreeDemonstrated passion and enthusiasm for using knowledge and skills to solve problems and produce high-quality workStrong object-oriented programming skills and demonstrated knowledge of good software engineering practicesAbility to quickly understand existing code and enhance and build on an existing architectureStrong math skills and solid understanding of algorithm design and optimizationDemonstrated ability to work both autonomously as well as with large and small teams of programmersExcellent written and verbal communication skillsJunior Software Engineer Preference to applicants with one or more of the following:C++ knowledge and skillsExperience developing training simulations, 3D environments, or serious gamesExperience using modeling and simulation techniquesExperience on mobile platform development (IOS, Android)Specialization in one or more of the following areas: UI, Tools Development, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Physics, Graphics, Networking, MathExperience with web-based technologies, including REST and JavascriptUnreal Engine or Unity programming skillsCompany Information:At the ARA Orlando office, we create immersive, 3D interactive learning solutions and high-fidelity synthetic virtual environments. We work with scientists and engineers of many disciplines and diverse backgrounds to enhance the creativity and innovation of the mission-critical solutions we provide to our customers.ARA is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems. ARA offices throughout the U.S. and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense, civil, and health technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. Around ARA you are equally likely to hear a conversation about Kubernetes clusters as you are a debate on merits of a reverse polish notation (RPN) calculator!While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) & 401(k) with matching program, benefits package which includes medical, dental vision, flex spending, telehealth services, company-paid life & disability insurance including paid maternity disability leave through our company-paid short-term disability benefit, domestic partner coverage, dependent care flex spending, daycare discounts, pet insurance, relocation opportunities, floating holidays, tuition reimbursement, professional development as well as flexible schedules with remote/work from home options. ARA also prides ourselves on having a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets, so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The company realizes employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women to maximize career and professional accomplishments. Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.

job.text_description: At ARA, we strive to hire valuable colleagues with not only the right skills, but also demonstrate our core values of passion, freedom, service and growth. As a Software QA Specialist on our team, you are the backbone of our strategic initiatives and will be responsible for developing technology critical to the success of our projects as well as national security.ARA has an immediate opening for a motivated software QA specialist to support our customer’s growth in the areas of engineering, research, and software development. This position offers an opportunity to participate in quality assurance and testing efforts on cutting-edge physics-based modeling and simulation software. Testing these complex applications requires skillfully employing software verification best-practices combined with an understanding of the complex physical effects they model and different users’ needs. In this position you will be part of the development team, working with developers and engineers to deliver reliable software which produces high-fidelity simulation results with interactive 3D visualization. As part of their growing Quality Assurance team, you will have the opportunity to work on multiple projects, help evolve our standard methodologies, and expand QA into new areas. As a valued contributor to our software team your responsibilities will include:Work with software engineers to understand the overall technical architecture and how each feature is implementedInterpret and report testing results, and be a vocal proponent for quality in every phase of the development processExtend and enhance our test frameworkCreate test plans and test cases to support new featuresReview user interfaces for conformity and functionalityFind, isolate, document, regress, and track bugs through resolutionTeam player with excellent communication skillsDue to the work you’ll perform and interactions with intelligence community and DoD programs you will need to be eligible to apply for and hold a US security clearance (selected applicants will undergo a security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements at the time of employment). job.text_description: Fantastic Senior Data Scientist opportunity to practice data science and oversee open-source data activities for a government customer in Washington D.C. (Joint Base Anacostia-Bolling). The position is part of a team that focuses on open-source data collection, data processing, data visualization, and data analysis using cutting-edge/innovative methods. Software development will often be performed by the team to expand capabilities. This position supports an ARA strategic initiative, enables career advancement, and contributes to national security.A senior data scientist is needed to perform assorted data science tasks upon open-source information; and supervise the work performed by a team of innovative data engineers and open source data collectors. At ARA, we strive to hire valuable colleagues with not only the right skills, but who also demonstrate our core values of passion, freedom, service, and growth. Serving in this position will promote fostering those values and supporting national security.The data scientist will be focused on developing operational analytics that result in workflow efficiency and/or extract new insights from collected data holdings. Leveraging available technology, they will work closely with both the data engineers and collectors to bridge technical gaps.Ideal candidates will seek opportunities to more rapidly or thoroughly address open source collection requirements with quantitative data. The data scientist will identify ways to cleanse and enrich publicly available information (PAI) datasets to better address these requirements.Data scientists will also be expected to support the government customer’s data evaluation objectives by ingesting and normalizing sample data into the query environment; conducting statistical analysis and providing subject matter expertise during evaluation exercises. Also, optimizing data extraction from large data sets; and creating, validating, and implementing data models to solve problems/answer questions.The data scientist will be required to convey his/her findings through written products, oral briefings, and interactive data visualization.Senior Data Scientist Required Experience & Skills:Must be a US Citizen with an active TS clearance with SCI eligibility and willing to submit to a counterintelligence (CI) polygraphBachelor’s degree in applicable field (data science, computer science, mathematics, computational analytics, etc.)Data Science experience (10+ years)Project Management experience (3+ years)Advanced use of Python, SQL, R or other statistical softwareUnderstanding of “big data” analytic methodologies and technologiesExpertise using Amazon Web Services and other cloud platformsBackground in geospatial data scienceSenior Data Scientist Preferred Experience & Skills:Above all, we value passion, a desire to learn, and teamwork. job.text_description: VGI is a 100% employee-owned custom software company supporting government missions and private sector enterprises for over a decade. VGI staff combine a strong technical prowess with a deep understanding of our customers and their operations. VGI can take your current network needs and challenges and create tools that protect your data throughout its lifecycle. Verite Group offers 100% paid Benefits, 20% Employer Contribution to 401K, Stock Options, Flex-Time, Year End Bonuses, Paid Overtime and many more Amazing first-class benefits.JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES:·  Verite Group, Inc. is actively recruiting top tier software engineering talent to join our development team. Verite Group, Inc. is both a software product development company and a consultancy.·  Developers for this position will be active in all phases of software development: design, implementation, testing, deployment, and support. In this position, you will work within small teams to develop and deploy mission-critical systems, reverse-engineer network application protocols, and develop tools for complex data and network analysis. Applications developed will vary from stand-alone scripts to complex, multi-threaded client / server architectures.·  Successful candidates will be strong engineers who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. The VG development team requires creative engineering balanced with high quality and customer focus. You will have the ability to work in an entrepreneur environment and be able to contribute to a high-energy team.REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Security Clearance: Clearable to TS/SCI Clearance ·  A Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science or a related field.·  Experience writing and debugging multi-threaded applications.·  Strong understanding of the TCP/IP stack and network protocols, especially as concerns communication of applications on the Internet.·  Familiarity with running/operating/debugging in a Linux environment.DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: ·  Experience with reverse engineering applications, with Java reverse engineering being the most desirable.·  C/C++/assembly programming experience.·  Experience with Mobile Application Development, with Android, programming being the most desirable, not required.WORK LOCATION: Washington DC Metro Area / Dulles, VATRAVEL: 0%You may apply through our external application link prompted by the green "Apply Externally" button.VGI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.
job.title: Software Engineer - R21-010

location_names: Raleigh, North Carolina, United States
job.text_description: At ARA we are driven by a passion for developing innovative solutions to challenging problems of national importance. Our culture rewards autonomy and initiative and we foster a stable environment where personal and professional growth are prioritized.For this position we are looking for highly skilled software engineers to join our augmented reality team. ARA’s ARC4 augmented reality technology is used by the US Army and others to improve the situational awareness of our soldiers on the battlefield. ARC4 provides accurate, timely information so that teams can make the right decisions and operate with enhanced safety and speed. It is not an overstatement to say that this capability will save lives, by improving coordination, decisiveness, and communication.Specifically, we need engineers and scientists who have the ability or interest to design and implement defense-grade augmented reality software. The software you develop will be fielded on a wide range of Army systems, including night vision goggles, ground vehicles, and far target locators.Our technology:C++17 application software built for Windows, Linux, and Android (heavy use of Android NDK) using Qt, OpenGL, Eigen, libUSB, and ZMQKotlin application software built for Windows and Android using JavaFXMicrocontroller software built in Rust and CEmbedded web server software built with Node.js and ReactCI build and package management system built with Jenkins, CMake, Gradle, and ConanOur team’s interests:Low-latency inter-device communication and high-performance inter-process data sharing. We write software that moves inertial sensor data and video data between embedded systems as fast as possible.Extensible software. We write applications for customers who want to build their own add-ons and plug-ins, so we think about APIs, data protocols and how to hot-load 3rd-party code.Safe concurrency. Knowing patterns for working with concurrent code safely is critically important for our applications.Cross-platform code. Our customers use many different platforms, so we know the difference between compiling with GCC vs Clang vs MSVC and when to utilize the JVM or web technology.Our code runs on devices that people work with and wear in heterogeneous processing hardware under unique resource constraints. This also means we employ multiple strategies to test our code from automated unit testing to device emulation and field testing.Putting math to work. Our products are often born from research projects which means learning and applying advanced math is how we deliver for our customers.Senior Augmented Reality Software Engineer Requirements:Due to the nature of work, qualified candidates must be U.S. CitizensA Bachelor’s degree in a STEM fieldAt least 7 years of demonstrated software development experienceA strong understanding of either C++17, Kotlin, or RustStrong experience in at least two of our technologies or interestsA desire to learn at least one of our other technologies or interestsAbout Us:Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1,500 professionals and continues to grow. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is highly impressive too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), benefits package, relocation opportunities, and a challenging culture where innovation & experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets so we give our employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take active roles as owners. The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. The corporation realizes that employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels.ARA is passionate about inclusion and diversity in our workplace. In 2018 40% of our new employees voluntarily self-identified as protected veterans. (Source-AAP EOY 2018 Veterans Data Collection Report). Additionally, the Southeast Division looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes ARA such a great place to work. Some of the social impact aspects we have implemented at our division include monthly get-togethers, team outings to local baseball games in the summer, board game lunches, holiday party, corn hole tournaments, chili cook-offs and so on. We are also very proud of our Women’s Initiative Network (WIN) whose purpose is to motivate, support, and encourage professional career development for women in order to maximize career and professional accomplishments. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.
