job.text_description: The purpose of this entry level sales training position is to prepare a person for a career in outside sales with SMC Corporation of America. The Sales Academy Trainee will participate in an extensive and advanced six-month paid training program at SMC’s North American Headquarters in Noblesville, Indiana and a continued six-month training program at the branch they are assigned. Upon completion of the training program, the trainee will be transitioned into a Sales Associate role at one of SMC’s sales branches across the United States and Canada.The Sales Academy Trainee will receive training that ranges from sales skills development and corporate culture to SMC’s applications, product line, and target industries served. They will learn about sales strategy, marketing and manufacturing production and order fulfillment. Specifically, the trainee will be required to participate in the following training activities:Actively take responsibility for learning the material as presented and become prepared to apply it.Actively participate in learning activities which demonstrate sales operations and supply chain functionalityComplete written and practical trainingActively participate in learning activities in a technical support roleComplete basic pneumatics training and other technical training as directed by SMC sales managementStudy product catalogs and manuals to gain a basic understanding of SMC productActively participate in learning activities which demonstrate “best in class” customer supportPartner with experienced SMC sales professionals on customer and distributor visitsCompletion and assistance in sales presentations and demonstrationsComplete short-term work assignments in all functional areas of the business (such as production, warehouse, customer service, etc.) as scheduled by the Sales Academy SupervisorParticipate in additional learning activities and opportunities as dictated by sales management and academy supervisors to promote a higher level of success in an outside sales rolePHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENTFast paced environment (includes both office and field work)Work on multiple projects at onceOccasional travel in a team training environment may be requiredPhysically capable of lifting SMC products and displays up to 50 lbs.Varying work hoursMINIMUM REQUIREMENTSMinimum two (2) year Technical degree or equivalent work experience, four (4) year degree preferred.Excellent communication skills.Proficient in the use of computers and ability to learn new programs and tools as required

job.text_description: The Safe Routes to Health AmeriCorps Program at the Michigan Fitness Foundation (SR2H) engages 20 half-time AmeriCorps members to serve at host sites statewide. Members will focus on addressing unmet health needs in underserved, low-income communities with the goal of increasing the skills, knowledge, and awareness of how to eat healthy and be active. Members receive training in a variety of areas to support and enhance their service to community residents and develop professional skills. Join us in promoting healthy futures for Michigan communities. Serving remote may be part of this position.

job.text_description: Crescent Academy is currently hiring an Elementary Teacher for grades 2nd - 5th. Classes Hybrid with possiblity of virtual. *Must have valid Michigan Teacher Certification.*Would you like to be a part of a school that believes strongly in its students and their right to a high quality education? Are you interested in creating an innovative, project based, experience for your students? If you possess the following qualities:·       Creativity and Innovated ideas about learning in the classroom·       Project based learning·       Familiar and knowledgeable with the Michigan Common Core Standards·       Enjoy challenges (social, economic) and addressing the whole child school of thought·       Engaged in learning and curriculum coupled with cross curriculum teaching and learning.·       Embracing a data driven mindset to help close achievement gaps·       Working with collegial peers through Professional Learning Communities (PLC) to improve teaching and learning objectives in the classroom.·       Using technology to support teaching and learning in the classroom.·       Able to meet time sensitive tasks and deadlines·       Possess great listening and writing skills·       Persistent characteristics ( closing achievement gaps, and data driven)·       Collaborating within a team and being pro-active·       Conflict resolution (parents and students)·       Empathy (students, parents, staff)·       Building positive relationships with students and parents·       Possess a great love for children and patience·       Creating a strong bridge between school and home.·       Working with underserved population of students·       Embracing the philosophy of mindfulness techniques·       Open to the use of restorative circles·       Willing to adopt “Time to Teach” classroom management framework and application.Competitive Medical, Dental, and Vision plans with a low employee contribution. 401K plan available. Life, ADD, STD, and LTD paid by 100% by the employer!﻿If this sounds like you and you also want to be a part of a flexible, supportive, family-oriented team, then Crescent is the place for you!Crescent Academy believes in the whole child approach which means that academy staff assists students and their families in bettering their outcomes by creating a college bound culture that expects and teaches strong character, academic achievement, and civic engagement.Students from all cultural backgrounds and all walks of life attend Crescent Academy.Crescent Academy serves over 1,200 students grade level PreK-8.

job.text_description: The 2021 Lead for Minnesota Fellowship is now accepting applications.Who We AreA single visionary leader rooted in humility can change a community. Many working together can transform our country.Lead for Minnesota works to ensure that our state's most dynamic and diverse young leaders are working on our toughest challenges. We believe that with the right leadership in the right places, we can reimagine the American Dream in a way that is:Shared. Where we all have strong communal ties and a common aspiration of equity and justice for all.Accessible. Where everyone has a chance at economic and civic mobility, no matter their zip code; andSustainable. Where our education system and public institutions are well positioned to grow and sustain the next generation of leadership that will be responsible for solving problems that we cannot yet see.NOTE: If you apply using the Handshake "Apply" button, we will contact you regarding next steps for the application. To be fully considered for the fellowship, all candidates must complete Lead For America's external application on AirTable. To begin the fellowship application, follow this link.Fellowship OverviewFrom the COVID-19 crisis to intergenerational poverty and ecological devastation, the challenges facing our communities and nation are immense. And our communities and public institutions––the very things designed to confront these challenges, give every American a chance at a better life, and care for those who can’t care for themselves––are crumbling exactly when we need them most. Lead For Minnesota's flagship fellowship program builds the leadership force we need to address these challenges at scale, to change the narrative of success and worth in our country, and to ensure that every child has a chance at a better life, no matter their neighborhood or family circumstances. The program is a paid, two-year fellowship for dynamic and diverse leaders ages 21-30 who return to their hometown communities and home states to work full-time alongside local public institutions implementing proven strategies to improve community wellbeing.ResponsibilitiesLFMN Fellows are community activators. You work to revitalize your community and show that another way of leading and living—rooted in love and collective wellbeing—is possible. The fellowship is structured to cultivate your personal leadership development, amplify your community impact, and support you in strengthening the civic fabric of your hometown for the long term. We truly view LFMN Fellows as co-creators and partners in developing and strengthening LFMN.The fellowship is based around 4 components:Project Scope:  Fellows add capacity for their public institution to tackle a community-identified “grand challenge”. By working within public institutions they will gain access to and develop an understanding of the key roles that they can play in growing & sustaining a vibrant community.Leadership Development + Support: Fellows participate in a month-long summer Catalyst Institute where they learn alongside professionals, academics, and social sector leaders across a multitude of fields, and receive leadership development, equity, and character-building training. Administered in partnership with Tufts University’s Tisch College of Civic Life, Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government, and the University of Minnesota, past Catalyst Institute have included over 60 speakers from all over the country, including Brookings Institution Centennial Scholar Bruce Katz, Nobel Peace Prize Nominee Amanda Nguyen, and the nationally renowned Mayor of Ithaca Svante Myrick. Fellows also engage in ongoing training, mentorship, support, and retreats throughout their two years of service.Listening Tour + Community Venture: Fellows conduct a Listening Tour of their community to identify areas where their unique talents and passions can serve greater community needs and inspire them to launch a Community Venture. Multiplier Effect:  Fellows will identify emerging opportunities for their communities and mobilize others, to seize them and invest in their communities alongside them. Fellows are expected to recruit an additional 5-10 young leaders to return, move to, or become activated to serve in their home communityApplicant-Led PositionsAt this time, we are accepting applications for applicant-led positions, meaning that candidates can apply to serve any community where they have strong personal ties. If selected as an Endorsed Finalist, LFMN will support applicant-led candidates in identifying a suitable host placement in their community of choice.Pre-Confirmed PositionsThe application for pre-confirmed positions (where specific placements have already been secured by LFMN in particular communities) will open in early 2021.TimelineCycle 1 (Applicant-Led)First Round Deadline: Nov. 15thFinalists Contacted: Nov. 23rdFinalist Interviews: Nov. 30th - Dec. 11thEndorsed Finalist Selection: Jan. 7thCycle 2 (Pre-Confirmed)First Round Deadline: Feb. 15thFinalists Contacted: Feb. 22ndFinalist Interviews: Feb 23rd - Mar. 5thEndorsed Finalist Selection: Mar. 22ndCycle 3 (Pre-Confirmed)First Round Deadline: Apr. 15thFinalists Contacted: Apr. 22ndFinalist Interviews: Apr. 23rd - May 7thEndorsed Finalist Selection: May 24thEligibility Guidelines-Be a US Citizen, Permanent Resident, or DACA Recipient.-Be under the age of 30 in June 2021 (this requirement can be flexible if you are a few years older than 30 but otherwise believe you are a compelling candidate)-If in college, be on track to earn an undergraduate degree by June 2021, and if graduated, have earned an undergraduate degree in 2012 or later (this may include an associate degree).-Be able to make a full-time commitment (the fellowship is a full-time job).Lead For Minnesota is an AmeriCorps program, and as such applicants are eligible to become AmeriCorps members if qualified.
job.title: 2021 Lead for Minnesota Fellowship

job.text_description: The AmeriCorps Together We Prepare (TWP) program has been an AmeriCorps*State program since 2005. The AmeriCorps TWP program is partnered with the Michigan Region of the American Red Cross with a primary focus in disaster services. The program works to provide disaster preparedness education to community members as well as local and national disaster response when needed. The TWP program places members throughout the Lower Peninsula of Michigan, including Ann Arbor, Detroit, Flint, Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo, Lansing, and Traverse City. All members in this program receive a bi-weekly living allowance and an education award upon successful completion.Member Duties : Schedule and facilitate Preparedness Education (PE) presentations - Act as a member of the Disaster Action Team (DAT), responding to local emergencies. This may include some weekends and overnights - Coordinate Red Cross involvement in community events and attend events - Participate in team meetings, relevant training, and service projects - Prepare and edit Preparedness Education materials as necessary - Assist the Disaster Program Manager in the coordination of the Sound the Alarm Campaign which includes outreach, media, planning events, recruiting volunteers, scheduling appointments, and coordinating home visits to install free smoke alarms in the community - Support fellow Together We Prepare members on their overall preparedness needs - Participate in National Days of Service - Promote AmeriCorps and the TWP program to community members - Wear the AmeriCorps logo at all times when earning service hours - Participate in professional development training Program Benefits : Childcare assistance if eligible , Living Allowance , Health Coverage , dental and vision , Education award upon successful completion of service
job.title: AmeriCorps Member-Disaster Cycle Services Associate-Detroit

job.text_description: Wake up each day knowing that you are a part of something special. Something real. Something bold. What you do can make a difference. Coyote is an industry-leading transportation and logistics service provider that believes in doing the right thing every time. Every hour. Every minute. Every second. Are you looking for a place where you will have a role in shaping an industry? Are you Tenacious, True, Tribal, and Smart? Then it’s time for you to apply to join the pack.As a Sales Representative at Coyote, you will focus on the fast-paced brokerage aspect of our business, helping customers move their inventory in the most cost-effective way by identifying and providing logistics solutions. As you start your sales career with Coyote, you will create and manage your individual portfolio of accounts through constant communication with carriers. These conversations include, but are not limited to, determining carrier availability, negotiating rates based on market trends, and identifying and resolving issues. Additional business is generated through inside sales by way of industry referrals and prospecting while upholding Coyote’s commitment to service. As a Sales Representative, you will participate in an on-site customer project which gives the opportunity to gain hands-on industry experience by spending 6 weeks at one of Coyote's customer locations. In shipping, there is a period of high demand for products, services and transportation capacity from November to the end of December therefore the project is in Q4. The customer project helps you as a Sales Representative build strong issue resolution skills and internal and external relationships.Skills, Characteristics, and Experience Strong work ethic, self-motivation, and sales drive Effective communication  Confident decision-making and problem solving skills Strong ability to negotiate  Customer service or sales experience preferred Bachelor’s degree desired Why Coyote? On-site training and ongoing career development Base salary and uncapped commission opportunity Comprehensive benefits package 401K with company match UPS Employee Stock Purchase Plan  Internal advancement opportunities for outstanding performers Important Notice to US Applicants:Coyote is an at-will employer.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.Please view Equal Opportunity Posters provided by the OFCCP.
job.title: Entry Level Sales Representative (Detroit)

job.text_description: DetailXPerts is growing dramatically! We are in search of Fleet Wash Supervisor that takes pride in doing an exceptional job, has an extraordinary eye for detail and is motivated by considerable growth within the company! We treat our employees like family! Duties will include but are not limited to:Oversee scheduling, training and performance of Detail TechniciansPressure wash commercial fleets, cars, trucks, and vans.Detail the interior and exterior of luxury cars and other vehicle's using our unique Steam equipment, all while catering to the customer's specific instructions.Apply polishes, conditioners, waxes and/or masking materials to preserve, protect, and restore vehicle's interior and exterior.Steam clean and vacuum vehicles interior carpets to remove loose dirt and debris. Bacteria are removed and interior sanitized with our unique steam system.Clean the upholstery and other surfaces using our eco-friendly cleaning agents, applicators, and cleaning devices.Establish and maintain interpersonal relationships, build trust and grow our client base by providing exceptional customer service with each detailing.Job Requirements: Must pass background check Must have reasonable driving record, reliable transportationDEPENDABLE, honest, hardworking and punctual. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment caring for customers and having pride for a job well done.***PLEASE INCLUDE: Resume, any Applicable Experience and a brief explanation of why you would be a good fit for our company.﻿DetailXPerts, the world's first eco-friendly mobile vehicle detailing business, has effectively harnessed the power of steam for washing and detailing vehicles. Our patent-pending method uses 99% less water than our competitors, yet delivers superior clean and shine all the time. This unique selling proposition combined with our unbeatable support and training are the reasons behind our success. Isn't it time you discover the possibilities?
